review: Hard to properly review because it quit working on the second day that I tried it.  Dead, as in dead.  Once I finally figured out how to contact Amazon and arrange to get it replaced, they are sending me another unit two day shipping.  That part eventually was good.  They are loathe to let a customer have a phone number here, apparently. The HD on the failed unit, prior to failure, did not seem to have very high definition...a bit fuzzy.  Also, Fire TV makes it difficult to do Netflix; the unit is designed to push you toward themselves.  We'll see how the new unit does on picture quality and I'll repost...Hoping for improvement.

review: I am a Prime member, but without DLNA support, Fire TV is a non-starter.  My 5 year old TV and DVD player both support DLNA and a host of other services.  I am looking for a single product that can front-end my new AV receiver, and DLNA is a must-have for my NAS-based video and music collection.
